TEI:
&teiHeader; &facsimile;
25 Katerine.
SEinte Katerine of noble kunne: cam, bi olde dawe
Hire fader was king, hire Moder Quyene &punctelev; boþe of þe olde lawe
Þe king . Coste. hire fader het. &punctelev; gret clerk þis Mayde was
Þare nas non of þe seue .Ars &punctelev; þat heo maister of nas
Maxentius het þe Aumperour &punctelev; In eche londe he let crie
Þat ech kynerich under him &punctelev; come to Alisaundrie
Euerech Man for is stat &punctelev; to don to heore godes sacrefise
hoso it lete, men scholde of him don &punctelev; swyþe stronge Iustise
Þo ech lond was þudere icome &punctelev; to don heore lawe
Seinte katerine wel hardeliche &punctelev; toward heom gan drawe
bihalues heo stod and biheold &punctelev; heore wrechche gydihede
heo sai&yogh; Anouri þe Maumates &punctelev; and manie cristine Men for drede
Þo hadde heo gret deol in hire heorte &punctelev; and blesse[de] hire anon
And forth anon to þe Aumperour &punctelev; baldeliche heo gan gon
"Sire," heo seide, "riche Aumperour þou art &punctelev; swiþe noble and hende
Þov scholdest þi wisdom and þi wit &punctelev; to some guode wende
Þat i segge for þe folie &punctelev; þat ich iseo eov do
So muche feorrene folk &punctelev; þov hast icleopet þarto
Grete Ioie in ouwer heorte &punctelev; þis temple &yogh;e makiez ifo
Þat is ymaud of lym and ston &punctelev; and of ouwer Maumates also
&YOGH;wy ne biholde &yogh;e þe hei&yogh;e templeâ€” &punctelev; for þerof wondri ov mai
Of þe heie heuene þat geth aboute &punctelev; abouen eov ni&yogh;t and dai
Of sonne and Mone and steorrene also &punctelev; fram þe este to þe weste
Þat trauaillieth and neuere werie ne beoth &punctelev; ne neuere ne habbeth reste
biþench þe wel and turne þi wit &punctelev; to some wisdome, ich rede
And &yogh;wane þin owene Inwit it seith &punctelev; þat nou&yogh;were nis swuch dede
Almi&yogh;ti god þou him hold &punctelev; þat swuch wonder can make
bifore alle oþere Anoure him &punctelev; and þine Maumates forsake."
With oþere resones of clergie &punctelev; þat mayde proffrede also
Þat heore godes nau&yogh;tes ne were &punctelev; þat heo Anoureden heom to
¶ Þe Aumperour stod and ne couþe þarto &punctelev; Answerie In none wise
Gret wonder him þou&yogh;te of hire fairhede &punctelev; and of hire Quoyntise
"Mayde," he seide, "abijd herewith &punctelev; forto aftur ore sacrefise
And we schullen more with þe speke &punctelev; ich oþur mi Iustise."
Þo þe sacrefise was idon &punctelev; þe Aumperour sat In is trone
And al is folk abouten him. &punctelev; men brouten þat Maide sone
"Maide," seide þe Aumperur &punctelev; "þou þinchest gent and freo
Of &yogh;wat kunrade art þou icome? &punctelev; gret wonder us þinchez of þe."
¶ "Sire Aumperur," þis Maide seide &punctelev; "Ine wilni bote luyte
to tellen þe of mine kunne &punctelev; for it were signe of pruyte
For In is boke þe wise Man &punctelev; Catun seith also
Þat Man ne schal himsulue preisi &punctelev; ne blamie noþemo
For so doth foles þat wilniez muche &punctelev; of &yogh;elpingue and of sunne
Naþeles ichulle, ake for no pruyte &punctelev; tellen eov of mine kunne
Ich am þe kingus dou&yogh;ter coste &punctelev; þat þou wost &yogh;wuch is
hidere ich cam to speke mid eov &punctelev; of þat &yogh;e bileuez amis
Mid vnri&yogh;te heo beozþ icleped godes &punctelev; þat o fot ne mouwen go[MS. gon]
Ne no man helpe in none neode &punctelev; ne heomsulue noþemo."
¶ "Maide," seide[MS. seide seide] þis Amperur &punctelev; "&yogh;if þat þis sothþ were
Al þis world were fals and guydi &punctelev; &yogh;if þou one heom[MS. heom heom] scholdest [lere]
And we schulle betere ileue alle men &punctelev; and more it wole beo note
Þane ani fol womman ase þou artâ€” &punctelev; for ouwer bolt is sone ischote."
"Sire," seide þis Maide þo &punctelev; "þei þou luyte telle of me
Also guod mai beo mi reson &punctelev; ase þat comez of þe
For, sire Aumperur, þou[MS. ich þou] art &punctelev; ase ech man is also
Þat hote mai and hys men moten &punctelev; nede hys hestes do
Of bodi and of soule þou art ymaud &punctelev; ase þisulf mi&yogh;t iseo
Mid ri&yogh;te þi soule Maister is &punctelev; and þi bodi is hyne schal beo
&YOGH;if þi bodi maister is &punctelev; and þi soule[superscribed later.] is hyne
A&yogh;en kuynde it is &punctelev; and þou worst sikur &punctelev; þarefore of helle pine."
Þoru&yogh; hire clergie þat holi Maide &punctelev; resones made so quoynte
Þat þe Aumperour ne non of his &punctelev; ne couþe hire ansuerie in none pointe
"Maide," he seide, "þou schalt abide &punctelev; In warde here mid me
And oþere ichulle bi tyme finde &punctelev; þat schullen Answerie þe."
Þis Aumperour sende anon &punctelev; wide aboute is sonde
Þat þe gretteste maistres of clergie &punctelev; to him comen In eche londe
grete Mede of him to habbe &punctelev; to don a luytel Maystrie
And forto susteinen op heore lawe &punctelev; þoru strencþe of clergie
So þat þare comen fifti Maistres &punctelev; þe gretteste þat man fond
Also wide ase men mi&yogh;ten seche &punctelev; ou&yogh;were In ani lond
Þe Aumperour heom seide anon &punctelev; &yogh;warefore he after heom sende
Forto desputi a&yogh;ein a &yogh;ong womman &punctelev; þat al heore lawe schende
"Nou is þis," þat .o. Maister seide &punctelev; "gret schame, ich onderstonde
An Aumperur to sende aboute &punctelev; so wide in eche londe
After þe gretteste Maistres, forto despuyti &punctelev; a&yogh;en a fol wenche
&YOGH;wane on of heore knaue mi&yogh;ten sone &punctelev; hire resones alle aquenche!"
"Nai," seide þis Aumperour &punctelev; "heo is wisore þane &yogh;e wene
&YOGH;if &yogh;e mouwen ou&yogh;t a&yogh;en hire don &punctelev; sone it worth isene
For ich habbe leouere þat &yogh;e hire ouercome &punctelev; with resones In some wise
Þane we with strencþe hire maden &punctelev; to don þe sacrefise."
"Lat bringue hire[superscribed.] forth," seide þat on &punctelev; "and heo schal segge anon
Þat heo ne spac neuere wit wisore men &punctelev; are heo fram us gon."
¶ An Aungel to þis maide cam &punctelev; and bad hire of noþing drede
And seide heo scholde heom alle þoru hire reson &punctelev; to cristinedom lede
And heo alle scholden þoru hire reson &punctelev; afonge martyrdam
Þo þat Maide iherde þis &punctelev; gret Ioie to hire heo nam
baldeliche heo eode forth &punctelev; þo men aftur hire come
"Sire," he[= heo] seide to þe Aumperur &punctelev; "&yogh;ifst þou a wis dom
Þat þus fale maistres of clergie &punctelev; bringest and sest abenche
And meself to desputy a&yogh;eines heom &punctelev; þat nam bote a fol wenche
And &yogh;if þat heo me ouercomez &punctelev; þou bihast heom gret mede
And makest me mid strencþe with heom speke &punctelev; and ne bihast me bote luyte
Þat þinchez me with onri&yogh;te it is &punctelev; &yogh;wane ich am one a&yogh;ein heom alle
¶ Nov ichulle, for god is min help &punctelev; afonge þat me wole falle."
"Seie, dame conIoun, &yogh;wat artþou?" &punctelev; þis o legistre seide
"Þenchestþou speke a&yogh;ein ore clergie? &punctelev; turne þi þou&yogh;t, ich rede
Þov seist þat god almi&yogh;ti &punctelev; dethz on eorþe þolede here
Ichulle proui þat he ne mi&yogh;te aliue beo &punctelev; nouþe In none manere
For, hoso deiez, he ne may &punctelev; neuerefft to liue come
&YOGH;wane þe vertue of al is bodi &punctelev; þoru deþe him is binome
And þi god almi&yogh;ti is ded &punctelev; þou ne mi&yogh;t libbe nou&yogh;t
&YOGH;if he þat scholde &yogh;iue þe lijf &punctelev; is to deþe ibrou&yogh;t."
¶ "Nai," seide þis holi mayde &punctelev; "þou faillest of þin art
Anoþur þou most segge, &yogh;if þou þencst &punctelev; of þine maistrie to habbe part
God hadde euere and euere he schal &punctelev; mid him is godhede
And for loue of us In ore flesche &punctelev; he nam him manhede
Of twei þingus he was þo imaked &punctelev; eiþur moste þo is kuynde afonge
For þe kunde of manhede us to bugge &punctelev; he þolede deth wel stronge
Ake forto bileue ded, a&yogh;en kuynde it was &punctelev; ase of is godhede
Þarefore he aros fram deþe to liue &punctelev; þo he hadde idon al is dede
For þe stronge deþe þat þoru&yogh; Adam &punctelev; we weren to ibrou&yogh;t
Þoru&yogh; is godhede, imeynd In ore kuynde &punctelev; nede moste beon ibou&yogh;t
&YOGH;if þou withseist þis reson &punctelev; an oþur ichulle þe make
Þat grete clerkes seiden In heore lawe &punctelev; þat man ne may nou&yogh;t forsake
¶ Platon, þe grete philosophe &punctelev; þat was heþene of ouwer lawe
he seide þat god wolde deie &punctelev; and himselue to liue a&yogh;en drawe
Lokiez In is boke,[omit in is boke] hov it mi&yogh;te beo soth &punctelev; nouþe In ouwere[r. oþer] manere
bote þe muchele god of heuene &punctelev; bicome a luyte Man here
Also Balaam, ouwer prophete &punctelev; þat heþene was also
In is bok he seideâ€”&yogh;e wuten wel &yogh;ware &punctelev; &yogh;if &yogh;e wollez loki þerto
Þat þare scholde of Iacobes kuynde &punctelev; a steorre arise wel bri&yogh;t
Þat scholde kinges and princes &punctelev; al binimen heom heore mi&yogh;t
Þat was þat ore louerd wolde &punctelev; of Iacobes kuynde beon ibore
&[added.] ouercomen alle þat euere weren &punctelev; sethþe oþer bifore
And &yogh;uyt þre kinges of ouwer lawe &punctelev; on þulke steorre þou&yogh;ten
For þe steorre þo god was ibore &punctelev; and þarefore lok him brou&yogh;ten."
Þo þeos Maistres heorden þis mayde speke &punctelev; of so grete clergie
heo ne couþen answerie hire of neuere a word &punctelev; and &yogh;euen hire þe maistrie
¶ Þo seide þe Aumperur In grete wrathþe &punctelev; "nis non of eov þat can
Among so manie grete Maistresâ€” &punctelev; answerie a fol womman?"
"Certes, sire," þis Maistres seiden &punctelev; "so gret clerk nov nis
Þat scholde to hire reson &yogh;iue answere &punctelev; for heo seith so[al. soþ] iwis
We seggeth, þe holie gost is with hire &punctelev; and In hire mouþe
Þat we ne conne hire answerie nou&yogh;t &punctelev; ne we ne dorren þei we couþe
Þarefore, bote we betere of oure lawe &punctelev; þane we &yogh;eot iseon
Alle we seggez with one mouþe &punctelev; cristine we wollez beon."
"Ey, trichours," seide þe Aumperur &punctelev; "is it icome þerto
Certes, &yogh;e schullen euerechone &punctelev; beo to stronge deþe ido."
he het þat Men scholden amidde toun &punctelev; furberne heom echone
And huy afenge þe deth for godes loue &punctelev; withoute anie mone
And muche reuþe heo maden to katerine &punctelev; Ibaptizede þat heo nere
Þat Maide heom confortede wel &punctelev; and cristine lawes gan heom lere
And seide þat heore stronge martyrdom &punctelev; þat heo þoleden þere
In stude of cristinedom scholde beon &punctelev; &yogh;if heo studefaste were
¶ Þis Maistres weren wel glade þo &punctelev; gladliche forth heo eode
And nomen þane deth for godes loue &punctelev; þat men heom wolde beode
Heo maden þe signe of þe croiz &punctelev; þo men in þat fuyre hem caste
And þo heo hadden longe ibarnd &punctelev; and dede weren atþe laste
And þat fuyr was al aqueynt &punctelev; alhole heo leien þere
&YOGH;wittore and wel fairore [of][om.] heu&yogh; &punctelev; þane heo euere er were
Þare nas so luyte wem on heom &punctelev; þat þe leste of heore here
Oþur of heore cloþus apeirede werenâ€” &punctelev; heo leien with faire chere
Þis Aumperur let fette anon &punctelev; þat Maide katerine
"haue reuþe of þisulf," he seide &punctelev; "and schild þe fram pine
haue reuþe of þi noble bodi &punctelev; þat is so fair and hende
For þou schalt beon in grete nobleye &punctelev; &yogh;if þou wolt þi þou&yogh;t wende
In mi paleis ich schal þe make &punctelev; hext after þe quene
After þi fourme ichulle þe make &punctelev; An ymage, bri&yogh;t and schene
Ouerguld and quoynte inov &punctelev; and sette as amidde þe cite
Þat ech man hire honouri schal &punctelev; for honour of þe
Ase men schullen to one god do. &punctelev; þou ne schalt mid al þi lore
So muche nobleie biþenche þe &punctelev; þat I nelle don þe more."
¶ "Sire Aumperur," þis Maide seide &punctelev; "let þi fole þou&yogh;t
For þov nast non more &yogh;wile to spille &punctelev; þane speken embe nou&yogh;t
god almi&yogh;ties spouse ich am &punctelev; and al þi blaundisinge
Ne alle þine tormenz ne schullen min heorte &punctelev; enes fram him bringe."
Þe Aumperur hire let strep[e] naked &punctelev; and to a piler faste hire bounden
With stronge schourges men beoten hire sore &punctelev; and maden hire harde wounden
Þo heo ne mi&yogh;ten þarewithal &punctelev; turnen hire þou&yogh;t
In depe prisone and swiþe deorke &punctelev; sone heo was ibrou&yogh;t
Þat no man hire mete ne &yogh;af ne drunch &punctelev; þei heo scholde for hungur deie
For heo scholde to heore lawe hire þou&yogh;[t] tuyrne &punctelev; and beon ibrou&yogh;t out of teie
In þat prison þat Maide lai &punctelev; twelf dawes and twelf ni&yogh;t
Þat heo noþer .et. ne dronk &punctelev; ne isai&yogh; non eorþelich li&yogh;t
A &yogh;wit coluere þare cam fram heuene &punctelev; to hire euerech dai
And brou&yogh;te hire fram heuene mete &punctelev; Into prisone ase heo lai
A day ase þe Aumperur was &punctelev; out of þe toune ifare
Þe Aumperesse þou&yogh;te on katerine &punctelev; and hadde of hire gret care
Of hire bede wel priueliche &punctelev; heo aros at midNi&yogh;t
And nam with hire sire porfirie &punctelev; þat was hire priue kny&yogh;t
Þo heo to þe prisone come &punctelev; heo isei&yogh;en þare gret li&yogh;t
gret wounder heom þou&yogh;te &yogh;warof were &punctelev; þe deorke stude so bri&yogh;t
Þo heo isei&yogh;en[al. sei&yogh;en heo] seinte katerine &punctelev; was In þe prisone grounde
And an Aungel of heuene with hire stonde &punctelev; and smerede hire wounde
¶ Þe Aumperesse cride anon &punctelev; "Katerine," heo seide, "þin ore
Mine ri&yogh;te bileue þov tech me &punctelev; I nelle beo fol non more."
Þe kni&yogh;t also, sire porfirie &punctelev; loude cride also
Þat muche folk þat þareaboute was &punctelev; sone cam þerto
Sire porfirie ful adoun to hire fet &punctelev; and merci he gan crie
With grete Ioye þis Maide prechede heom &punctelev; of god and seinte marie
So þat Aumperesse and porfirie &punctelev; þoru&yogh; þis Maide þere
And twei hondred of oþur folk &punctelev; Ibaptizede weren
¶ Ore louerd himsulf cam sethþe adoun &punctelev; to seinte katerine
"Lo," he seide, "here ich am &punctelev; for &yogh;wam þou hast þis pine
In þine tormenz beo studefast &punctelev; Ichulle beo mid þe
Þi sege is in heue[ne] imaud &punctelev; þare þov schalt wonien mid me."
An oþur dai þe Aumperour &punctelev; after þis Maide sende
Þat heo were ded, oþur al furfare &punctelev; swiþe wel he wende
Þis Maide was bifore him ybrou&yogh;t &punctelev; swiþe fat and round
"&YOGH;wat," he seide, "hou geth þis? &punctelev; heo is hol and sound
&YOGH;ware beoth þis traitores," he seide &punctelev; "þat hire In prisone wuste
Stilleliche heo hire habbeth ifed &punctelev; þat no man it nuste
bi þe treuþe þat i schal to Mahon &punctelev; heo ne schullen so nonmore!"
he let nime alle þe gayholers &punctelev; and tormenti heom ful sore
¶ "Sire Aumperur," þis Maide seide &punctelev; "is þis a guod Ivggement
gultelese Men for mine gulte &punctelev; to bringe in swuche torment
he þat hath me ifed &punctelev; him ne drat of þe ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t
For an Aungel it was of heuene &punctelev; þat mete me hath ibrou&yogh;t
Do me &yogh;wat torment þat þov wolt &punctelev; and lat heom quite gon
Forsoþe, þat[al. of þat] þou on heom seist &punctelev; gult heo ne habbez non."
"Ey., hendie Maide Katerine" &punctelev; seide þis Aumperour
"Þench opon þi noble stat &punctelev; of alle Maidenes þov art flour
Torne þi þou&yogh;t and þou schalt beon &punctelev; þe Aumperesse per
heo ne schal noþing bifore þe habbe &punctelev; bote þat heo me mot beo ner."
"guode man," seide þis holie mayde &punctelev; "þov spext embe nou&yogh;t
For al þi pouwer þou ne schalt &punctelev; fram ihesu crist wende mi þou&yogh;t
Al þat torment þat þou mi&yogh;t þenche &punctelev; And of alle [day longe,[d. l. wr. by a later hand on an erasure.]
Þov mi&yogh;t don me &yogh;if þou wolt &punctelev; redi ich am to fonge
For ich ne wilni noþing so muche &punctelev; ase mi flechs and mi blod, iwis
to &yogh;iue for mi louerdes loue &punctelev; þat for me he &yogh;af his."
Þo was þe Aumperur so wroth &punctelev; þat he was nei&yogh; iswowe
Four &yogh;weles of Iren he let fullen &punctelev; with rasores, kene Inowe
And with ginne heom makede tuyrne aboute &punctelev; þe tweien on þat on half opward
Þe oþur tweine euene heom a&yogh;ein &punctelev; In þat oþur half adoneward
Þat, hoso bitwene were &punctelev; In none half ne mi&yogh;te him wende
Þat þe rasores nolden al is flechs &punctelev; todrawen and torende
Sone so þis Maide was idon þaron &punctelev; hire bodi forto schende
Ore swete louerd fram heuene &punctelev; an Aungel to hire gan sende
Þis Aungel with a drawe swerd &punctelev; þe &yogh;weoles altohev
Þat þe peces aboute flowen &punctelev; ase corn &yogh;wane man it sev
And smot[al. smite] of þis luþere men &punctelev; wel harde to þe grounde
Four þousend þ[er]e weren aslawe &punctelev; In a lutel stounde
Þo nuste þe Aumperur &yogh;wat he mi&yogh;te don &punctelev; for deol ne for sore
Þe Aumperesse nolde hele hire stat &punctelev; lengore þo nammore
¶ "Sire," heo seide, "hou gez þis? &punctelev; for godes loue, þin ore
Ich iseo þat þis mayde is guod &punctelev; and of holi lore
Ower Maumates ichulle forsake &punctelev; Inelle on hem bileue more."
Þo gan þe Aumperur for wrathþe &punctelev; loude &yogh;eolle and rore
he ne mi&yogh;te fram Ihesu crist &punctelev; hire þou&yogh;t noþing wende
he het men þat[r. þat men] scholden hire lede &punctelev; to þe tounes ende
And hire bresten fram hire bodi &punctelev; with Irene crokes rende
And þareafter smiten of hire heued &punctelev; þe more forto[r. hire to] schende
Wit guode heorte þe Aumperesse &punctelev; þane deth gan afonge
Þe quellares heo bad hi&yogh;en faste &punctelev; and ne abiden nou&yogh;t to longe
Heo nomen þe kene crokes of Ire &punctelev; þat hire flechs depe gnowe
And, also man draweth with combes wolle &punctelev; hire tetes heo todrowe
Fram hire bodi mossel mele &punctelev; and sethþe smiten of hire heued
Þat bodi, for houndes it scholden ete &punctelev; vnbured it was bileued
Ake porfirie it burede ani&yogh;t &punctelev; þat holi bodi and guod
Þo þe Aumperur þat bodi miste &punctelev; he was wroth and wod
he tormentede þarefore manie Men &punctelev; þat ne mi&yogh;ten heom nou&yogh;t skere
Þo eode porfirie forth &punctelev; and seide, "sire, lo me here
Ich burede þat holie bodi &punctelev; þat was cristus make
And to Ihesu crist ich habbe also &punctelev; al min heorte itake
For no pouwer þat þou mi&yogh;t don &punctelev; Inelle him forsake."
Þo gan þe Aumperur for deol and sor &punctelev; alle is lymes to schake
¶ "Mahun," he seide, "hou schal þis beo? &punctelev; &yogh;wat schal ich nou do
Nov Ich habbe mi wif forlore &punctelev; and mi kni&yogh;t porfirie also
And porfirie al min heorte was! &punctelev; &yogh;wy neltþou me rede?"
Þo wenden þis oþure kny&yogh;tes forth &punctelev; and loude heo gonne grede
"We nellez þane deth for godes loue &punctelev; no leng bileue for drede."
Þo gan þe Aumperur todrawe is her &punctelev; and sore siche and grone
"Mahun," he seide, "&yogh;wat schal ich do? &punctelev; hov schal ich bileue allone
&YOGH;wi neltþou raþer fette me &punctelev; and bringe me of þusse liue
Þane soffri alle mine men to leose &punctelev; after mine leoue wiue
Þei þou nelle, mahun, helpe me &punctelev; Ine forsake þe nou&yogh;t
Þis foles þat habbez þe forsake &punctelev; to deþe heo schulle beo brou&yogh;t."
He let nime porfire þene guode kny&yogh;t &punctelev; and is felawes echone
And smiten of heore heuedes withoute toun &punctelev; ase Mahones fon
Þo let he fette katerine &punctelev; "Dameysele," he seide
Þei þov me binome mi wijf &punctelev; mid þine fole rede
Ichulle, &yogh;if þou wul torni þi þou&yogh;t &punctelev; fur&yogh;iue þine misdede
And with gret nobleie ase min Aumperesse &punctelev; oueral with me þe lede."
¶ "Certes, sire," þis Maide seide &punctelev; "þis wordes beoth alle for nau&yogh;t
Þov ne schalt me neuere bringue fram him &punctelev; þat hath min heorte icau&yogh;t
Do þat þov wolt, and haue idon &punctelev; and bring þi wille to ende
For þou ne schalt neuere for noþing &punctelev; min herte fram Ihesu wende."
"&YOGH;ware beo &yogh;e, mine quellares?" &punctelev; þe Aumperur þo seide
"Faste &yogh;e schulle þe wychche binde &punctelev; and withoute toune lede
And smitez[r. smite] of hire heued anon &punctelev; an don þe guode dede
Þat heo ne bringe us neuereft &punctelev; In soruwe ne In drede."
Þo þis Maide was ibrou&yogh;t &punctelev; to slene withoute þe toun
hire preiere heo maude to god &punctelev; aknes heo sat adoun
"Louerd," heo seide, "graunte þou me &punctelev; þat ech man þat hath in[om. in] mone
In ani neode oþur in ani anuy &punctelev; of mine passione
graunte þat he mote to is wille &punctelev; help afonge sone."
Þo cam ore louerd himself to hire &punctelev; and grauntede hire bone
¶ "Cum forth," he seide, "mi suete leman &punctelev; mi leue spouse also
heuene&yogh;at a&yogh;ein þe Iopened is &punctelev; þare þou schalt comen to."
A quellare hire heued of smot. &punctelev; þat folk þat aboute heom stode
&YOGH;wijt Milk heo isei&yogh;en eorne out of þe wounde &punctelev; and nou&yogh;t o drope of blode
Aungles comen and nomen þat bodi &punctelev; among alle þe manne
And to þe hul of synay it beren &punctelev; tuenti Iorneies þanne
And bureden it þare In one faire place &punctelev; wit grete nobleye and riche
Þare þoru&yogh; Ihesu cristes grace &punctelev; hire bones restez &yogh;uyte
Þareof &yogh;eot to þis day &punctelev; þare eornez eoille wel riue
&YOGH;warewith manie sike Men &punctelev; beoz to hele ibrou&yogh;t and to liue
Wide In londe it is ilad &punctelev; þat hoso it habbe mote
Noble relike it is also &punctelev; sike Men to don bote
Þre hundred &yogh;er and twenti &punctelev; after þat god was ibore
IMartred was þis holie Maide &punctelev; of &yogh;wam we tolden bifore
Ihesu crist, for þe suete loue &punctelev; of seinte Katerine
graunti us þe Ioye of heuene &punctelev; and schilde us fram helle pine
Amen amen, segge we alle &punctelev; for is holie tyme
